title: Fun and simple ways to help the new kid in class feel welcome!
text:
Fun and simple ways to help the new kid in class feel welcome!

(Shannon Fagan/123RF)

When you started the new school year and looked around your classroom, did you notice any unfamiliar faces? It can be hard for new kids to start a school year if they don't know any other kids in the class.

Let’s help make the first week for the new students in your classroom a memorable one! Here are some tips on being a good friend:



Say ‘hi’ to your new classmate and introduce yourself. If you see them playing alone at recess, invite them to join you and your friends. Don’t forget a smile goes a long way!



Give them the inside scoop on your school

You can also make them a personalized “Welcome to the School” guide. In this handy little booklet (illustrated by you!) you can share your favourite things about your school.



Do you have a favourite class or teacher? Do you have a favourite class or teacher?

What about a favourite game to play at recess?

Where is the best best book in the library?



Recommendations are the BEST — and since you’re the expert, it’s always fun to give others the best tips on exploring their new community.

All you need to do is print out the Welcome to the School PDF, add some awesome drawings and cut along the dotted line. You can use a stapler or glue to attach the pages.

Give your booklet to your new friend!
